tags: taylorswit reputation setlist tswift taylurking swiftie reputationtour
summary: Something I think we all need to think about.....
body:
Something I think we all need to think about…..

I’m not saying this to rationalize all of you but I see people on here expressing their interest in politics and talking so viciously is because Taylor brought their attention to it. And there is no problem with that but I feel as if some of you have not educated yourselfs on the beliefs of some parties and their policies. Yes there are some canidates that SUCK and are not the best people but that does not mean you should go shouting “FUCK MARSHA BLACKBURN”. Because that is not what Taylor told you to do. She told you to stand up for what you believe in and vote and thats what we did. Think about what Michelle Obama said….”when they go low we go high”….PLEASE think about what this means!!!! We have a president and people in power using harmful and offense lanauage, making racist and sexist comments to get their points across and that is what I see some people doing in return to fight them. That is going to get us no where. Just because someone is republican does not mean they are a bad person!!!! Meghan McCain for example is a republican who believes in equal rights. I am a young women who identifies with Democracts on social issues and Republicans on fiscal issues, but I choose to vote blue….why??? Because, I see social issues as equality more important than others. And that is okay!! Our society forces us into 2 parties but people don’t nesscarly fit into one of the 2 categories….political allingment is a SPECTRUM!! A spectrum just like how we are fighting for people who’s gender and sexuality fall onto a spectrum. So please do not attack people based on what of the two categories they put themselves into. Do not attack someone based on their beliefes they are confidant in. If you keep attacking someone, our political climate in this country is going to go backwards.


If anyone has any constructive criticism on my post please message me and let me know or ask me questions.


Thank you for reading this if you have. Please be kind to one another.


@taylorswift @taylorswift @taylorswift @taylornation

summary: This article defends Taylor (and Beyoncé) for the election results
title: This article defends Taylor (and Beyoncé) for the election results
body:
After the election results came out, we all know that Phil Bredesen whom Taylor endorsed didn’t win this time. Unsurprisingly, some haters started to blame Taylor for endorsing him, as the article wrote:

Some pundits immediately took to social media to blame Swift and Beyoncé for the race results, claiming that their endorsements actually had a negative impact on their candidate’s ability to win.

But fans were quick to point those remarks were sexist.

As the polls closed and results became apparent, people began to blame Swift and Beyoncé for the evening’s results — despite the fact that both Bredesen and O'Rourke faced uphill battles to victory in Republican-heavy states.

Tweets directed at Swift seemed to reduce the singer to the men in her life, joking that Bredesen was just more fodder for her next album, and comparing Bredesen to other men in her life. The story reinforces the trope that a woman can be reduced and distilled into her relationships with men.

The tendency to blame celebrities for political wins or losses, speaks to our general cultural confusion over how a celebrity is supposed to wield their power. While it’s certainly a meaningful gesture for celebrities of this magnitude to use their enormous platforms to encourage people to vote, it is not their responsibility, nor is it a requirement of fame. Saying that two women — and a woman of color, especially — didn’t do enough to help two men win an election is steeped in misogyny and racism, as the singers’ fans noted.

As a fan of @taylorswift , a woman of color and a feminist, I see these kinds of misogyny comments targeting on Taylor on the social network platforms all the time. 

When Taylor stayed out of politics, people blame her for not being active enough, even spreading rumors about her rooting for Trump. When she spoke out and then the result wasn’t what we expected, she got ridiculed and blamed.  Like seriously what would you guys want this woman to do? You kept ignoring Kanye for being a racist and publicly support Trump. 

Most importantly, those people all ignored the fact that Taylor didn’t campaign for voting Democrats, she encouraged people to vote based on who most closely represents your values. And that’s the true spirit of democracy and the reason who you should exercise your rights.

When she spoke out and then the result wasn’t what we expected, she got ridiculed and blamed.  Like seriously what would you guys want this woman to do? You kept ignoring Kanye for being a racist and publicly support Trump. 

Most importantly, those people all ignored the fact that Taylor didn’t campaign for voting Democrats, she encouraged people to vote based on who most closely represents your values. And that’s the true spirit of democracy and the reason who you should exercise your rights.

blog.description:
Hi! I'm Gem, 20, from Sydney, Australia. Swiftie since forever. So I made a joke on Instagram in 2014 and Taylor replied with "I almost just fell out of bed laughing", best day ever and it still makes me smile just thinking about it!

💕 instagram // @gemmyswift 💕
